byline.contributor: Campbell Robertson reported from Little Rock, and Richard Pérez-Peña from New York. Erik Eckholm contributed reporting from New York, and Monica Davey from Chicago.
byline.original: By CAMPBELL ROBERTSON and RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA

abstract: Arkansas passes its own version of bill portrayed by supporters as a religious freedom law, while Indiana Gov Mike Pence faces critics who contend its law could be wielded to discriminate against gay couples; Arkansas Gov Asa Hutchinson says he will sign measure, while Pence faces pressure on both sides from business and conservatives.
lead_paragraph: As Arkansas passed its own measure, Indiana’s governor responded to growing criticism by those who say the legislation could be used to discriminate against gay couples.

headline.main: Bills on ‘Religious Freedom’ Upset Capitols in Arkansas and Indiana
headline.print_headline: Bills on ‘Religious Freedom’ Upset Capitols in Two States
